structured_data.name: High-Resolution Gridded Livestock Projection for Western China Based on Machine Learning
structured_data.subsector: Emissions from livestock within the city boundary
structured_data.description: This article describes a high-resolution gridded livestock projection for Western China based on machine learning. It is published in the journal Remote Sensing by MDPI.

structured_data.name: Modelling the distribution of chickens, ducks, and geese in China
structured_data.subsector: Emissions from livestock within the city boundary
structured_data.description: This study developed 1km resolution population density models for China's chickens, ducks, and geese. It used an information theoretic approach to predict poultry densities based on statistical relationships between poultry census data and high-resolution agro-ecological predictor variables. The output includes mean and coefficient of variation maps for each species, intended for use in epidemiological studies and livestock policy/management.
structured_data.temporal_coverage: May 2011 (publication date), data used for modeling is census data, specific period not mentioned.

structured_data.name: CELL5M: A Multidisciplinary Geospatial Database for Africa South of the Sahara
structured_data.description: The CELL5M database is a multidisciplinary geospatial database for Africa South of the Sahara (SSA) developed by HarvestChoice, IFPRI, and University of Minnesota. It includes over 750 biophysical and socio-economic indicators at a five arc-minute spatial resolution, covering over 350,000 grid cells. It supports decision-making for agricultural investment and cross-cutting spatial analyses at the nexus of poverty, health and nutrition, farming systems, innovation, and environment. The database also provides a standard-compliant data API. The work was undertaken as part of the CGIAR Research Program on Policies, Institutions, and Markets (PIM) led by IFPRI, with funding from PIM, the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, and USAID Bureau for Food Security. (2016-02-11)

structured_data.name: Annual 30-m maps of global grassland class and extent (2000–2022) based on spatiotemporal Machine Learning
structured_data.method_of_access: Downloadable PDF, Cloud-Optimized GeoTIFFs, Google Earth Engine assets
structured_data.description: This paper describes the production and evaluation of global grassland extent mapped annually for 2000–2022 at 30m spatial resolution. The dataset shows the spatiotemporal distribution of cultivated and natural/semi-natural grassland classes, produced using GLAD Landsat ARD-2 image archive, climatic, landform and proximity covariates, spatiotemporal machine learning (per-class Random Forest), and over 2.3M reference samples. The maps are available under an open data license.

structured_data.name: Copernicus Global Land Cover Layers—Collection 2
structured_data.method_of_access: Google Scholar search for the article title, implying access to the publication, but no direct data access method is specified in the provided content.
structured_data.subsector: Emissions from land within the city boundary
structured_data.description: The content mentions 'Copernicus Global Land Cover Layers—Collection 2' in the context of Google Scholar search, suggesting it is a dataset or publication related to global land cover. No further details about its content, provider, time period, or update frequency are available in the provided text.

structured_data.name: Spatial Data and Analytics (SDA)
structured_data.method_of_access: web interface query, downloadable files (MapSPAM, HarvestChoice Datasets, DREAM model)
structured_data.description: The Spatial Data and Analytics (SDA) research theme by IFPRI focuses on leveraging big data, remote sensing, and artificial intelligence to enhance monitoring, measurement, and management of farming systems for sustainable food production. It aims to apply data-driven solutions to reduce hunger and poverty, transforming genomics, crop breeding, climate modeling, and agronomy. The project has been ongoing since 2014 and includes applications in agricultural statistics, crop insurance, crop procurement, land use, and rural finance.

structured_data.name: High-resolution maps of intensive and extensive livestock production in China (HIEL-China)
structured_data.method_of_access: Downloadable PDF, potentially data available through authors or associated research
structured_data.subsector: Emissions from livestock within the city boundary
structured_data.data_format: Not explicitly stated for the dataset itself, but the article is a PDF. Implied gridded data (30"x30" grid).
structured_data.description: This study presents a spatially detailed dataset on intensive (point) and extensive (30"x30" grid) livestock production in China (HIEL-China) for 2017. It is developed based on an improved model and multi-scale data, providing reliable estimation of livestock density with increased spatial accuracy. The dataset aims to address underestimation in previous datasets and shows different structures of livestock production systems in urban, peri-urban, and rural areas. It has broad application prospects in studies concerning food security and environmental sustainability.

structured_data.name: ESA WorldCover
structured_data.description: ESA WorldCover provides global land cover mapping at high spatial resolution (10m) using data from Copernicus Sentinel-1 and Sentinel-2 satellites. It supports various sectors including biodiversity monitoring, food security, carbon assessment, and climate change. The 2020 version was completed in October 2021, and an improved 2021 version was released on 28 October 2022. It shows 11 different land-cover classes.

structured_data.name: Land Processes Distributed Active Archive Center (LP DAAC) Data
structured_data.method_of_access: Earthdata Search, LPDAAC Data Resources GitHub, AppEEARS
structured_data.description: The Land Processes Distributed Active Archive Center (LP DAAC) operates as a partnership between the United States Geological Survey (USGS) and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) dedicated to enabling natural resource managers, disaster responders, academia, and industry to investigate, characterize, and monitor land surface processes. It provides access to trusted, well-documented earth science datasets at no cost, supporting science applications ranging from agriculture and geology to urban heat and wildfire mitigation. LP DAAC processes, archives, and distributes more than 14 petabytes of land remote sensing data from major missions such as ASTER, MODIS, VIIRS, ECOSTRESS, GEDI, EMIT, and HLS. ECOSTRESS specifically measures the temperature of plants to better understand how much water plants need and how they respond to stress, addressing agricultural vulnerability.

structured_data.name: ECIRA - European crop-specific irrigated area at 1 km resolution annually from 2010 to 2020
structured_data.method_of_access: Downloadable PDF, View on publisher site
structured_data.description: The European Crop-specific IRrigated Area (ECIRA) dataset provides annual 1-km gridded crop-specific irrigated area for 16 crop types across 28 European countries for 2010–2020. It was developed by the Department of Crop Sciences, University of Göttingen and the Institute for Food and Resource Economics (ILR), University of Bonn.

structured_data.name: Mapping livestock density distribution in the Selenge River Basin of Mongolia using random forest
structured_data.subsector: Emissions from livestock within the city boundary
structured_data.description: This study introduces a spatialization method using random forest (RF) to obtain high-resolution gridded distribution data of total livestock, sheep & goats, cattle, and horses in the Selenge River Basin, Mongolia. It analyzes the contribution of factors influencing the spatial distribution of livestock and provides fundamental support for animal husbandry regulation in the Mongolian Plateau or other large steppe regions worldwide.

structured_data.name: Landsat-Derived Global Rainfed-Cropland Product L2 2020 30 m V002
structured_data.description: The Landsat-Derived Global Rainfed-Cropland Product Level 2 2020 (LGRIP30_L2_RAIN) Version 2 data provides high-resolution, 30 meter (m) cropland data to assist and address food and water security issues. It maps agricultural lands by dividing them into rainfed single croplands and rainfed single croplands mixed with natural vegetation, and calculates applicable cropland areas across the globe. Produced using Landsat 8 time-series satellite sensor data for the 2019-2021 period for a nominal 2020 product. Currently covers the conterminous United States (CONUS), with global coverage to be added later. Provided by LP DAAC (Land Processes Distributed Active Archive Center).

structured_data.name: A cultivated planet in 2010 - Part 2: The global gridded agricultural-production maps (SPAM2010)
structured_data.method_of_access: Downloadable via an open-data repository (DOI: https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/PRFF8V) and available on MapSPAM website (http://mapspam.info/)
structured_data.description: SPAM2010 provides the latest global spatially explicit datasets on agricultural production circa 2010. It includes methodological and data enhancements to the SPAM (Spatial Production Allocation Model) dataset family, such as updated base year, extended crop list (from 20 to 42 major crops), and expanded subnational administrative-unit coverage. It estimates crop area, yield, and production under four farming systems across a global 5 arcmin grid. The data is provided by IFPRI.

structured_data.name: WorldCover
structured_data.description: WorldCover provides global land cover products for 2020 and 2021 at 10 m resolution, developed and validated based on Sentinel-1 and Sentinel-2 data. It is developed by a consortium of European service providers and research organizations.

structured_data.name: GAEZ agro-climatic suitability index
structured_data.method_of_access: Web interface query, downloadable files (implied by GAEZ DATA PORTAL link)
structured_data.description: The GAEZ agro-climatic suitability index assesses land suitability for different crops (Wetland Rice, Dryland Rice, Wheat, Maize) based on climate, soil, and terrain conditions. Developed by FAO and IIASA, the Agro-Ecological Zones (AEZ) framework evaluates crop suitability and production potential under specific conditions to aid in sustainable agricultural decisions. Source data is from the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO).

structured_data.name: Land Use/Land Cover Data Access and Tools
structured_data.method_of_access: Web interface query, downloadable files (HDF-EOS, GeoTIFF)
structured_data.subsector: Emissions from land within the city boundary
structured_data.description: NASA provides various land use/land cover datasets and tools, ranging from global assessments of snow cover albedo to food insecurity cropland extent measurements. These datasets help researchers translate interconnected data points into actionable knowledge. The page highlights commonly used land cover/crop extent data from MODIS, GFSAD, and GLanCE, covering periods from 2001 to 2021.

structured_data.name: Generating global crop distribution maps: From census to grid
structured_data.description: This research paper describes a new crop allocation model that estimates crop area, yield, and production for 20 major crops under four rainfed and irrigated production systems across a global 5 arc minute grid. It builds on prior work for Latin America and the Caribbean (LAC) and sub-Saharan Africa (SSA), incorporating comparative advantage and economic worth. The methodology accounts for spatial variation in biophysical conditions and uses crop prices for allocation. It also allows for inclusion of partial, existing sources of evidence and feedback on local crop distribution patterns through spatial allocation priors and an entropy-based optimization procedure. The paper compares global datasets and discusses factors influencing their differences, providing recommendations for improving reliability and utility of crop production distribution data.

structured_data.name: GCI30: a global dataset of 30 m cropping intensity using multisource remote sensing imagery
structured_data.description: GCI30 is a global, spatially continuous cropping intensity map dataset at 30m resolution, developed using multiple satellite data. It provides insights into agricultural land use intensity and indicates that single cropping is the primary agricultural system globally. The dataset covers the period 2016-2018 and is available on Harvard Dataverse.

structured_data.name: Global Pasture Watch - Annual grassland class and extent maps at 30-m spatial resolution (2000—2022)
structured_data.sector: Agriculture, Forestry, and Other Land Use (AFOLU)
structured_data.subsector: Emissions from land within the city boundary
structured_data.description: Global annual grassland class and extent maps for 2000—2022 produced by Parente et al. (2024) within the scope of the Global Pasture Watch initiative. The dataset classifies grassland into 'Cultivated grassland' and 'Natural/semi-natural grassland' based on specific vegetation and land use criteria.

structured_data.name: A global open-source dataset of monthly irrigated and rainfed cropped areas (MIRCA-OS) for the 21st century
structured_data.description: A new data library of subnational crop-specific irrigated and rainfed harvested area statistics combined with global gridded land cover products to develop a global gridded (5-arcminute) irrigated and rainfed cropped area (MIRCA-OS) dataset. It covers 23 crop classes and supports insights into spatially detailed patterns of irrigated and rainfed cropland change.

structured_data.name: Global Agro-Ecological Zones (GAEZ)
structured_data.method_of_access: Web interface with data access guides and links to specific data categories
structured_data.sector: Agriculture, Forestry, and Other Land Use (AFOLU)
structured_data.granularity: Global to sub-national levels (GAEZ v3.0 offers a standardized framework for the characterization of climate, soil and terrain conditions relevant to agricultural production, which can be applied at global to sub-national levels.)
structured_data.description: The Global Agro-Ecological Zones (GAEZ) dataset, developed by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) and the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA), provides comprehensive assessments of agricultural resources and potential. It includes data on land and water resources, agro-climatic resources, suitability and potential yield, actual yield and production, and yield and production gaps. The assessment has been continuously developed over the past 30 years, with global assessments performed every few years since 2000. This is the most ambitious assessment yet, aiming to make publicly available the entire database and all results, amounting to many terabytes of data.
structured_data.spatial_resolution: 5' grid cell for actual yield and production; GAEZ v3.0 can be applied at global to sub-national levels.
structured_data.temporal_coverage: Time series data from the Climate Research Unit (CRU) are used for agro-climatic resources; first global AEZ assessment in 2000, with updates every few years since.

structured_data.name: Annual Agriculture in the Paraguayan Chaco 2000/2001
structured_data.method_of_access: Not specified, likely direct access or download from the source.
structured_data.description: Map of soy crop areas in 2000/2001 in the Paraguayan Chaco, elaborated based on the interpretation of Landsat images of 30 m spatial resolution. Provided by Agrosatélite Geotecnología Aplicada.

structured_data.name: SPAM 2020 V2
structured_data.description: The latest version of SPAM (Spatial Production Allocation Model) provides global grid-level data on crop distribution for 42 crops. It uses a cross-entropy approach to estimate crop distribution within disaggregated units, moving data from coarser units (countries, subnational provinces) to finer units (grid cells) to reveal spatial patterns of crop performance. Previous versions (SPAM 2000, 2005, 2010, 2017) are also available.
structured_data.temporal_coverage: 2020 (V2), with previous versions for 2000, 2005, 2010, and 2017 (SSA only)

decision_log.summary: This batch of documents contains a mix of academic papers and data portals. The Harvard Dataverse entry for CELL5M is highly promising as it explicitly states it's a multidisciplinary geospatial database with over 750 biophysical and socio-economic indicators for Africa South of the Sahara, at a 5 arc-minute resolution, and provides download options. The ScienceDirect article on poultry distribution in China is a research paper that describes the creation of 1km resolution density models, which could be valuable if the underlying data is accessible or the methodology is highly relevant for similar data generation. The MDPI link appears to be a journal's table of contents or a machine-readable page, not directly a data source. Several other links returned 'No content available', indicating issues with scraping or irrelevant pages.
decision_log.reasoning: The Harvard Dataverse link directly points to a geospatial database highly relevant for agriculture exposure, meeting the resolution and format criteria. The ScienceDirect article describes the creation of high-resolution agricultural exposure data, which warrants further investigation to see if the data is available or the methodology is directly applicable. The other 'No content available' links need to be re-scraped or are likely irrelevant.

decision_log.summary: The extracted data primarily focuses on land cover, land use, and agricultural production, with a strong emphasis on gridded datasets. Several entries provide global coverage at fine spatial resolutions (30m, 10m, 1km, 5 arcmin), which is highly relevant for exposure assessment in agriculture. Key sources include reputable organizations like NASA, ESA, IFPRI, FAO, and academic publishers (Nature, MDPI, ScienceDirect). While there's good coverage of agricultural land, specific exposure indicators related to population, built environment, economic, socioeconomic vulnerability, health, and governance are largely missing, as expected for an 'agriculture' specific exposure search. The current search plan was for 'Global cropland extent', 'ESA WorldCover', and 'Global Food Security-support Analysis Data (GFSAD)', and the extracted data aligns well with these queries, providing relevant datasets for agricultural exposure.
decision_log.reasoning: The extracted datasets are highly relevant, credible, and provide excellent coverage for the 'agriculture' component of exposure at a global scale and fine resolution. They directly address the initial search queries and provide valuable geospatial data for CCRA. While other exposure categories are not covered, this is consistent with the specific 'agriculture' focus of the search. These datasets are ready for use in quantitative risk assessment.
